g.text: Shading is a likely management technique for adapting coﬀee to warmer climates
). Previous studies suggested that shade trees protect
in extended dry periods, increase soil moisture and air humidity (
). The beneﬁts reduce coﬀee physiological stress, adapting the plants to high
Additionally, shaded coﬀee agroforests play an important role as mitigation action.
Carbon stocking and sequestration have been documented in the biomass associated
with the shade tree component of coﬀee agroforestry, making the system a carbon
is important to preserve natural resources (
), improving biodiversity, social and ﬁnancial characteristics (
Shaded-grown system is a relevant mitigation strategy, however, it is not always
considered as an adaptive option. The main limiting factors to adopt shaded-
grown systems are the competition (for light, water, and nutrients), the intense labor
), and the changing pathogens and insects
). On the other hand, the full
sun system does not provide ecosystem service beneﬁts, such as carbon sequestra-
tion and climate regulation, pest and disease control (
Shaded-grown coﬀee has diﬀerent functional roles when compared to full sun sys-
tem, making it more ecologically sustainable (
and less economically fragile. In this context, some studies suggested that from low
60%), it is a good balance between ecological,
Despite all beneﬁts, especially for mitigation purposes, there is still a gap of knowl-
edge to understand the ideal level of shade cover and howshade trees may aﬀect cof-
fee meteorological variables inside the gradient of shading, especially considering
low to moderate shade (30% or less). Previous studies reporting temperature
decrease, cup quality, yield, coﬀee disease in shaded-grown coﬀee areas, normally
assessed extreme treatment, including less than 15% or more than 70% of shading
The understanding of how high temperatures may be reduced in coﬀee production
systems through the microclimate modiﬁcation provided by shade cover is still
). One way to increase the knowledge about these
systems is the use of mathematical models and numerical simulations (
). The Envi-met microclimatic simulation software has emerged as a
